recipe.title: Acquacotta
recipe.ingredient: Any Italian herbs (parsley or basil) you have on hand (optional)
recipe.step:
c/o The Epoch Times - which I think was accidentally put in my letter box. (The name translated means cooked water, but it is so much more than that!)
Heat oil in large pot and cook garlic on low for 10 minutes. Add carrots and celery and cook for a further 5 minutes. Sprinkle in chili and stir well, then add water, stock cubes, tomatoes, wine and salt and pepper. Bring to boil then reduce to a simmer and cook for 1 hour. Once done add ricotta then blend with stick blender, if desired. You can poach the eggs directly in the soup if desired. Place bread in bowl, pour soup over bread and place one egg per bowl. Garnish with herbs if desired.
